commentary.revenue_performance: Consolidated revenue declined by 5.5% due to a **one-time inventory correction** to enhance distributor profitability. Secondary sales grew by 2.3%. Rural outpaced urban growth for the 3rd consecutive quarter.
commentary.profitability: Operating Profit declined by 16.4% due to **revenue deleverage** from the inventory correction. Gross margins expanded by 102 basis points. The inventory correction aimed to bring **distributor days** down from 30 days to 21 days.
commentary.business_outlook: Management expects growth to be back on track in upcoming quarters. Forecasted **mid- to high single-digit growth** in the second half, driven by good winters (La Nina).
commentary.key_challenges: The major challenge was the monsoons and floods which slowed urban consumption and caused a decline in the Juices and Nectar category. The inventory correction was a one-off proactive measure taken in the GT channel.
commentary.strategic_initiatives: Dabur signed an agreement to **merge Sesa Care Private Limited** to enter the premium Ayurvedic hair oil segment. Dabur Red became the 1st Ayurvedic toothpaste accredited by the Indian Dental Association (IDA).
commentary.market_conditions: Urban consumption has **bottomed out**. Food inflation (9%) remains a worry, shifting monies from discretionary to essential items. Dabur gained market share in 95% of its portfolio.
